newsitem.title: USA: US OMB mid-session budget review postponed - Raines.
newsitem.headline: US OMB mid-session budget review postponed - Raines.

text.p: The White House Office of Management and Budget will postpone its mid-session review of the budget until after Congress completes budget legislation, Budget Director Franklin Raines said in a letter.

The letter dated Tuesday was sent to members of Congress informing them of the postponement of the report, usually issued in mid-July, on the current U.S. fiscal situation and outlook for the next five years.

"The report will be most helpful if it reflects the legislative action to implement the budget agreement on which the Administration and Congress are now working," Raines wrote. "By contrast, it makes little sense to issue a report that will be out of date within weeks," he added.
